goals.question: What is the range of values for X and Y?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of X and Y
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of data points in the dataset and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between X and Y?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of X and Y with a trend line
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between X and Y and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of X?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of values for X and identify any patterns or outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of Y?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of values for Y and identify any patterns or outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of X and Y together?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the joint distribution of X and Y and identify any patterns or outliers.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['X'], data['Y'])
    plt.xlabel('X')
    plt.ylabel('Y')
    plt.title('What is the range of values for X and Y?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='X', y='Y', ax=ax)
    sns.regplot(data=data, x='X', y='Y', ax=ax, scatter=False, color='red', label='Trend Line')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between X and Y?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['X'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='X')
    plt.axvline(data['X'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['X'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('X')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of X?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['Y'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Y')
    plt.xlabel('Y')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of Y?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    x = data['X']
    y = data['Y']
    
    plt.hist2d(x, y, bins=30, cmap='viridis')
    plt.colorbar(label='Frequency')
    plt.xlabel('X')
    plt.ylabel('Y')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of X and Y together?', wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
